title: An injury scare had a Providence goalie in net for the Bruins on Thursday
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Michael DiPietro filled in for injured Bruins goalie Joonas Korpisalo during a 4-2 win over Columbus.
DiPietro, an emergency call-up, played 6:03, making two saves before Korpisalo returned to the game.
Coach Marco Sturm praised both DiPietro's performance and Korpisalo's recovery, who finished with 36 saves.

title: N.H. woman arrested for alleged murder of her baby following 11-month investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Hepay Juma, 26, was arrested for the alleged murder of her baby, found dead in Pine Island Pond, Manchester.
Juma faces reckless second-degree murder charges, accused of showing 'extreme indifference' to human life, say officials.
The infant, identified as 'Baby Jane Doe,' was discovered on March 27, 2025; investigation into the death continues.

title: Way overdue on checking a carâ€™s transmission fluid
author: John Paul
bullets: Car Doctor advises on a 2006 Mazda3 with black transmission fluid; recommends another drain and refill if shifting is smooth.
A 2019 Subaru Crosstrek's $1,600 recommended repairs include tire pressure sensors and control arm bushings, with alternative cost suggestions.
For a 2018 GMC Denali, antifreeze may evaporate; Car Doctor recommends monitoring levels and pressure testing if frequent top-offs are needed.

title: South Shore school evacuated after snow causes ‘structural stress’ on roof
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Hingham's Plymouth River School evacuated due to roof's structural stress from snow accumulation.
Students were relocated to Hingham High School; lunch and transportation were provided.
Hingham experienced over 17 inches of snow during the recent blizzard, intensifying roof concerns.

title: David Ortiz changes his tune on Rafael Devers after previous criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Ortiz criticized Rafael Devers' defense and fitness last season, leading to Devers' trade to the Giants.
In a recent podcast, Ortiz expressed respect and support for Devers, despite past criticisms and tensions.
Ortiz believes Devers' experience with the Red Sox was a lesson, hoping it improves his performance with the Giants.

title: Gas leak identified as cause of Taunton explosion that displaced 8 residents
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gas leak identified as the cause of a Taunton explosion that destroyed a home and injured two individuals.
The explosion at 78 Plain St. displaced eight residents and damaged two neighboring homes, according to Taunton fire officials.
Community fundraisers have raised over $33,000 for the victims, including a mother and daughter hospitalized due to the incident.

title: Patriots reportedly remain a bottom-10 team in new NFLPA report card
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots ranked 26th out of 32 teams in the 2026 NFLPA report card, an improvement from previous years.
New England's team plane and travel resources received low marks, with the plane rated last in the league.
A new facility is planned for 2026, expected to improve low ratings in areas like weight room and training room.

title: Malden teacher, basketball coach arraigned amid allegations he raped high school foster child
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Scott Marino, 54, a teacher and basketball coach, was arraigned on rape charges involving an 18-year-old foster child.
The alleged assault occurred while the victim was in the foster care of Marino and his wife in Stoneham.
Marino was released on $75,000 bail with GPS monitoring and is due back in court on April 16.

title: State Police sergeant charged with assaulting driver during traffic stop
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Sergeant Joel Daoust charged with assault during January traffic stop in Springfield for speeding and lane violations.
Daoust faces charges of assault and battery, including with a dangerous weapon, after using pepper spray on driver.
State Police suspended Daoust without pay; had prior disciplinary actions in 2015 and 2017 for separate incidents.

title: Readers push back on ChatGPT use in Massachusetts executive branch
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Governor Maura Healey announced Massachusetts as the first state to implement ChatGPT for executive branch employees.
65% of over 100 polled Massachusetts readers oppose using AI assistants, citing security and environmental concerns.
Healey defends the AI initiative, emphasizing improved government efficiency and secured access for state workers.
